datasetPresenter.name: vcorATCC50505_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description: Whole genome shotgun sequence and annotation was generated by The Broad Institute Genome Sequencing Platform with Federal funds from the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases National under Contract No.: HHSN2722009000018C. EuPathDB downloaded this data from The Broad Institute.
datasetPresenter.usage: Sequence and annotation can be searched based on a variety of parameters such as genomic location, gene ID and BLAST similarity (for a full list of queries see the Searches using these data section below). The sequence and annotations can be viewed in GBrowse along with any functional data that maps to it.

datasetPresenter.name: eromSJ2008_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description: This dataset contains the sequence and annotation of Encephalitozoon romaleae SJ-2008. Illumina sequencing resulted in an assembly of 2,138,148 bp distributed among 13 contigs. The average sequencing coverage is 300X for this intermediate sized genome (2.5 Mbp). EuPathDB downloaded the data from GenBank.
datasetPresenter.usage: Sequence and annotation can be searched based on a variety of parameters such as genomic location, gene ID and BLAST similarity (for a full list of queries see the Searches using these data section below). The sequence and annotations can be viewed in GBrowse along with any functional data that maps to it.

datasetPresenter.name: vculfloridensis_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description: The sequence and annotation for Vavraia culicis floridensis were produced at The Broad Institute to a depth of 27X using 454 sequencing. EuPathDB downloaded the data from the Broad Institute.
datasetPresenter.usage: Sequence and annotation can be searched based on a variety of parameters such as genomic location, gene ID and BLAST similarity (for a full list of queries see the Searches using these data section below). The sequence and annotations can be viewed in GBrowse along with any functional data that maps to it.

datasetPresenter.name: aalgUndeen_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description: This dataset contains the sequence (Genoscope) of Anncaliia algerae Undeen. Approximately 110 Mb of DNA sequence was obtained from random shotgun sequencing using the Sanger method, resulting in an estimated 4.77 coverage of the genome which is estimated to 23 Mbp. Reads were assembled into 8,427 contigs with a N50 length of 2.209 kb. EuPathDB downloaded the data from Genbank.
datasetPresenter.usage: Sequence and annotation can be searched based on a variety of parameters such as genomic location, gene ID and BLAST similarity (for a full list of queries see the Searches using these data section below). The sequence and annotations can be viewed in GBrowse along with any functional data that maps to it.

datasetPresenter.name: htvaOER-3-3_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description: Hamiltosporidium tvaerminnensis OER-3-3 Sequence. Genomic DNA was obtained from purified spores isolated from a laboratory culture of infected Daphnia magna host. EuPathDB downloaded the data from GenBank.

datasetPresenter.name: eaedUSNM41457_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description: E. aedis USNM 41457 Sequence and Annotation. The genome was sequenced at a 20X coverage using 454 sequencing methods. EuPathDB downloaded the data from GenBank

datasetPresenter.name: ehelSwiss_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description: Sequence and annotation provided by Patrick Keeling and Jean-Francois Pombert at the Canadian Institute for Advanced Research, Evolutionary Biology Program, Department of Botany, University of British Columbia.

datasetPresenter.name: ecunEC3_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description: E. cuniculi EC3, whole genome shotgun sequence was generated by The Broad Institute Genome Sequencing Platform with Federal funds from the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases National under Contract No.: HHSN2722009000018C. EuPathDB downloaded the sequence from GenBank.

datasetPresenter.name: ecunEC2_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description: E. cuniculi EC2, whole genome shotgun sequence was generated by The Broad Institute Genome Sequencing Platform with Federal funds from the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases National under Contract No.: HHSN2722009000018C. EuPathDB downloaded the data from GenBank.

datasetPresenter.name: nemaSp1ERTm2_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description:
Microsporidia species originally isolated from wild-caught C. briggsae in Periyar Natural Preserve in Kerala, India (nematodes isolated by Marie-Anne Felix, microsporidia identified by Emily R. Troemel, see Troemel et al 2008). ERTm2 propagated in C. elegans N2 to generate genomic DNA, which was isolated by Emily R. Troemel (at the University of California-San Diego). Whole genome shotgun sequence was generated by The Broad Institute Genome Sequencing Platform with Federal funds from the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases under Contract No.: HHSN2722009000018C as part of the Microsporidian Genomes Consortium, white paper written by Christina A. Cuomo and Emily R. Troemel. (http://www.broadinstitute.org/annotation/genome/microsporidia_comparative/MultiHome.html, http://www.broadinstitute.org/files/shared/genomebio/Microsporidia_wp.pdf).
Genome annotation was aided by RNA-seq analysis of N. parisii ERTm1: RNA isolated by Malina A. Bakowski (University of California, San Diego) and RNA-seq performed at the Broad Institute. Work at UC-San Diego supported by NIH R01 AI087528 to E.R.T. Genome analysis by Christina A. Cuomo, Christopher A. Desjardins, Malina A. Bakowski, Emily R. Troemel.

datasetPresenter.name: nparERTm3_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description:
Microsporidia species originally isolated from wild-caught C. elegans in rotting apple in park in Santeuil, France (nematodes isolated by Marie-Anne Felix, microsporidia identified by Emily R. Troemel, see Troemel et al 2008). ERTm3 propagated in C. elegans N2 to generate genomic DNA, which was isolated by Emily R. Troemel (at the University of California-San Diego). Whole genome shotgun sequence was generated by The Broad Institute Genome Sequencing Platform with Federal funds from the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases under Contract No.: HHSN2722009000018C as part of the Microsporidian Genomes Consortium, white paper written by Christina A. Cuomo and Emily R. Troemel. (http://www.broadinstitute.org/annotation/genome/microsporidia_comparative/MultiHome.html, http://www.broadinstitute.org/files/shared/genomebio/Microsporidia_wp.pdf)
Genome annotation was aided by RNA-seq analysis of N. parisii ERTm1: RNA isolated by Malina A. Bakowski (University of California, San Diego) and RNA-seq performed at the Broad Institute. Work at UC-San Diego supported by NIH R01 AI087528 to E.R.T.
Genome analysis by Christina A. Cuomo, Christopher A. Desjardins, Malina A. Bakowski, Emily R. Troemel.

datasetPresenter.name: ebieH348_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description: E. bieneusi H348 sequence and annotation. EuPathDB downloaded the data from Genbank.

datasetPresenter.name: ecunEC1_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description: E. cuniculi EC1, whole genome shotgun sequence was generated by The Broad Institute Genome Sequencing Platform with Federal funds from the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases National under Contract No.: HHSN2722009000018C and obtained from GenBank (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/bioproject/63135).

datasetPresenter.name: nparERTm1_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description:
Microsporidia species originally isolated from wild-caught C. elegans in a compost pit in Franconville, near Paris, France (nematodes isolated by Antoine Barriere and Marie-Anne Felix, microsporidia identified by Emily R. Troemel, see Troemel et al 2008). ERTm1 propagated in C. elegans N2 to generate genomic DNA, which was isolated by Emily R. Troemel (at the University of California-San Diego). Whole genome shotgun sequence was generated by The Broad Institute Genome Sequencing Platform with Federal funds from the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases under Contract No.: HHSN2722009000018C as part of the Microsporidian Genomes Consortium, white paper written by Christina A. Cuomo and Emily R. Troemel. (http://www.broadinstitute.org/annotation/genome/microsporidia_comparative/MultiHome.html, http://www.broadinstitute.org/files/shared/genomebio/Microsporidia_wp.pdf).
Genome annotation was aided by RNA-seq analysis of N. parisii ERTm1: RNA isolated by Malina A. Bakowski (University of California, San Diego) and RNA-seq performed at the Broad Institute. Work at UC-San Diego supported by NIH R01 AI087528 to E.R.T.
Genome analysis by Christina A. Cuomo, Christopher A. Desjardins, Malina A. Bakowski, Emily R. Troemel (see Cuomo et al, 2012).

Cuomo et al. describes genome sequence assembly, annotation and analysis.
Troemel et al. isolation of four Nematocida strains (ERTm1, ERTm2, ERTm3, ERTm4) and characterization of life cycle of N. parisii ERTm1 strain.

datasetPresenter.name: ehelATCC50504_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description: Genome Sequence for E. hellem ATCC 50504 was downloaded from Genbank (GenomeProject ID #53973).
datasetPresenter.releasePolicy: Note: In the latest version of this genome the IDs of 138 genes on chromosome 5 were inadevertantly reused making it impossible to create a clean mapping. Click here for the list of these IDs.]] patrick.keeling Bioproject home page at GenBank

datasetPresenter.name: eintATCC50506_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description: Sequence and annotations from Patrick Keeling at Canadian Institute for Advanced Research, Evolutionary Biology Program, Department of Botany, University of British Columbia for Encephalitozoon intestinalis ATCC 50506 chromosomes in EMBL (sequence and annotated features) format.

datasetPresenter.name: ecunGBM1_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description: Sequence and annotation from BioHealthBase for E. cuniculi GB-M1 chromosomes in Genbank (sequence and annotated features) format.

datasetPresenter.name: ncerBRL01_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description: The whole genome shotgun sequence assembly for N. ceranae BRL01 was downloaded from Genbank.

datasetPresenter.name: nparERTm1_Troemel_Time_Course_rnaSeq_RSRC
datasetPresenter.summary: N. parisii infection in C. elegans time course assayed by mRNA sequencing.
datasetPresenter.description:
Time course transcriptome of N. parisii infection in C. elegans assayed by RNA-sequencing.
N. parisii ERTm1 parasites were isolated from C. elegans intestinal cells at 8, 16, 30, 40, and 64 hours post-infection. The 8, 16, and 30 hour time-points consist only of the replicative meront stage, while the 40 and 64 hour time-points contain a mixture meronts, sporonts and mature transmissible spores. RNA sequencing was performed on mRNA from each time point.
datasetPresenter.usage: EuPathDB maps the RNA-seq reads to the genome and allows users to search for genes based on this mapping. The transcript levels for individual genes are displayed as graphs on gene record pages. RNA-seq reads aligned to the genome can be displayed in GBrowse.
datasetPresenter.acknowledgement: Broad Institute Sequencing Platform was used for generating sequence data.

templateInjector.prop: Transcript levels of fragments per kilobase of exon model per million mapped reads (FPKM). Stacked bars indicate unique and non-uniquely mapped sequences. Non-Unique sequences are plotted to indicate the maximum expression potential of this gene.

datasetPresenter.name: aalgPRA339_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description: Annacaliia algerae PRA339 is an insect isolate sequenced to 270X coverage using Illumina methods.

datasetPresenter.name: aalgPRA109_primary_genome_RSRC
datasetPresenter.description: Anncaliia algerae PRA109 is a human isolate sequenced to 59X coverage using Illumina methods.
